summary: Email correspondence from Deutsche Bank's legal representatives to the SDNY regarding document production in response to a July 11, 2019 subpoena. The email corrects a file labeling error and provides access to a large document submission related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: SDNY Subpoena to Deutsche Bank
events.description: The SDNY issues a subpoena to Deutsche Bank for documents related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Deutsche Bank Document Production
events.description: Deutsche Bank, through its legal representatives, submits an additional production of documents to the SDNY in response to the July 11 subpoena.

events.title: File Labeling Correction
events.description: Deutsche Bank's representatives send a follow-up email correcting a mislabeled file in the previous night's document submission and provide a corrected copy.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was responding to a subpoena from the SDNY dated July 11, 2019, indicating an active financial investigation into Epstein.
The document production was substantial, including a 287.3 MB zip file and several other attachments (cover letters, spreadsheets, PDFs).
A file in the initial submission was mislabeled, prompting a corrective follow-up email, highlighting the volume and complexity of the document transfer.
The correspondence uses secure file-sharing methods (Citrix Sharefile) and contains confidentiality notices, indicating the sensitive nature of the materials.
